verses.text: So the enchanters, the magicians, and the diviners of the Chaldeans came in, and I told them the dream; but they did not make known its interpretation to me,
parts: So the enchanters, the magicians, and the diviners of the Chaldeans came in, and I told them the dream; but they did not make known its interpretation to me,

verses.text: until at last Daniel came in (whose name is Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and who has the Spirit of the Holy God in him).
parts: until at last Daniel came in (whose name is Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and who has the Spirit of the Holy God in him).

verses.text: “Belteshazzar, chief of the enchanters, I know that the Spirit of the Holy God is in you, and no mystery is impossible to you.
parts: “Belteshazzar, chief of the enchanters, I know that the Spirit of the Holy God is in you, and no mystery is impossible to you.

verses.text: I was on my bed, and I looked and behold, in the midst of the earth there was a very tall tree.
parts: I was on my bed, and I looked and behold, in the midst of the earth there was a very tall tree.

verses.text: The tree was large and strong.
parts: The tree was large and strong.

verses.text: Its leaves were beautiful and its fruit abundant, and in it there was food for all.
parts: Its leaves were beautiful and its fruit abundant, and in it there was food for all.

verses.text: “I saw in a vision of the night on my bed, and behold, a watcher, a holy one, came down from heaven.
parts: “I saw in a vision of the night on my bed, and behold, a watcher, a holy one, came down from heaven.

verses.text: He cried with a loud voice and said thus: ‘Chop down the tree, and cut off its branches.
parts: He cried with a loud voice and said thus: ‘Chop down the tree, and cut off its branches.

verses.text: Nevertheless, leave its stump and roots in the ground, and he shall lie down outdoors in the tender grass, wet with the dew of heaven and bound with an iron and copper chain.
parts: Nevertheless, leave its stump and roots in the ground, and he shall lie down outdoors in the tender grass, wet with the dew of heaven and bound with an iron and copper chain.

verses.text: His heart shall be changed from that of a man, and the heart of a wild animal will be given to him.
parts: His heart shall be changed from that of a man, and the heart of a wild animal will be given to him.

verses.text: This saying is by the decree of the watchers, and this decision by the word of the holy ones, so the living might know that the Lord is the Most High over the kingdom of men, and will give it to whomever He will, and set over it even objects of contempt among men.’
parts: This saying is by the decree of the watchers, and this decision by the word of the holy ones, so the living might know that the Lord is the Most High over the kingdom of men, and will give it to whomever He will, and set over it even objects of contempt among men.’

verses.text: “This is the dream I, Nebuchadnezzar the king, have seen.
parts: “This is the dream I, Nebuchadnezzar the king, have seen.

verses.text: Then Daniel, whose name is Belteshazzar, became mute about one hour, and his thoughts disturbed him greatly.
parts: Then Daniel, whose name is Belteshazzar, became mute about one hour, and his thoughts disturbed him greatly.

verses.text: The large and strong tree you saw, whose top reached to heaven and its extent to all the earth,
parts: The large and strong tree you saw, whose top reached to heaven and its extent to all the earth,

verses.text: and its leaves were flourishing and its fruit abundant, and in it there was food for all, and the wild animals lived beneath it, and the birds of heaven dwelled in its branches—
parts: and its leaves were flourishing and its fruit abundant, and in it there was food for all, and the wild animals lived beneath it, and the birds of heaven dwelled in its branches—

verses.text: this is you, O king, for you have become great and strong; and your greatness has extended and reached to heaven, and your dominion to the ends of the earth.
parts: this is you, O king, for you have become great and strong; and your greatness has extended and reached to heaven, and your dominion to the ends of the earth.

verses.text: “Inasmuch as the king saw a watcher, a holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, ‘Chop down the tree and destroy it, but leave its stump and roots in the ground, and he shall spend the night outdoors in the tender grass, wet with the dew of heaven and bound with an iron and copper chain, and his portion shall be with the wild animals, until seven years bring a change upon him’— this is its interpretation, O king, and this is the decree of the Most High, which has come upon my lord the king: They shall drive you from men, and your dwelling shall be with the wild animals.
parts: “Inasmuch as the king saw a watcher, a holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, ‘Chop down the tree and destroy it, but leave its stump and roots in the ground, and he shall spend the night outdoors in the tender grass, wet with the dew of heaven and bound with an iron and copper chain, and his portion shall be with the wild animals, until seven years bring a change upon him’— this is its interpretation, O king, and this is the decree of the Most High, which has come upon my lord the king: They shall drive you from men, and your dwelling shall be with the wild animals.

verses.text: They shall drive you from men, and your dwelling shall be with the wild animals.
parts: They shall drive you from men, and your dwelling shall be with the wild animals.

verses.text: “Inasmuch as they said, ‘Leave the stump and the roots of the tree,’ your kingdom will remain for you, after you come to know the heavenly authority.
parts: “Inasmuch as they said, ‘Leave the stump and the roots of the tree,’ your kingdom will remain for you, after you come to know the heavenly authority.

verses.text: Therefore, O king, let my counsel be pleasing to you, to atone for your sins with alms and your wrongdoings with compassion on the poor.
parts: Therefore, O king, let my counsel be pleasing to you, to atone for your sins with alms and your wrongdoings with compassion on the poor.

verses.text: All these things came upon Nebuchadnezzar the king.
parts: All these things came upon Nebuchadnezzar the king.

verses.text: After a period of twelve months he was walking about the royal palace in Babylon.
parts: After a period of twelve months he was walking about the royal palace in Babylon.

verses.text: The king spoke, saying, “Is not this the great Babylon which I built as a home for my kingdom, by my mighty power for the honor of my glory?”
parts: The king spoke, saying, “Is not this the great Babylon which I built as a home for my kingdom, by my mighty power for the honor of my glory?”

verses.text: While the word was still in the king's mouth, a voice came from heaven, saying, “King Nebuchadnezzar, your kingdom has passed from you, and they shall drive you from men.
parts: While the word was still in the king's mouth, a voice came from heaven, saying, “King Nebuchadnezzar, your kingdom has passed from you, and they shall drive you from men.

verses.text: and they shall drive you from men.
parts: and they shall drive you from men.

verses.text: That very hour the word was accomplished upon Nebuchadnezzar, for he was driven from men, ate grass like an ox, and his body was covered with the dew of heaven, until his hair was like that of lions and his nails like birds’ claws.
parts: That very hour the word was accomplished upon Nebuchadnezzar, for he was driven from men, ate grass like an ox, and his body was covered with the dew of heaven, until his hair was like that of lions and his nails like birds’ claws.

verses.text: At the end of the time, I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted my eyes to heaven, and my understanding returned to me.
parts: At the end of the time, I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted my eyes to heaven, and my understanding returned to me.

verses.text: All the inhabitants of the earth are counted as nothing, and He does according to His will with the army of heaven and with the habitation of earth.
parts: All the inhabitants of the earth are counted as nothing, and He does according to His will with the army of heaven and with the habitation of earth.

verses.text: At that time, my understanding returned to me, and I came again into the honor of my kingdom.
parts: At that time, my understanding returned to me, and I came again into the honor of my kingdom.

verses.text: Now therefore, I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise, exalt beyond measure, and glorify the King of heaven; because all His works are true, His paths are just, and He is able to humble those who walk in arrogance.
parts: Now therefore, I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise, exalt beyond measure, and glorify the King of heaven; because all His works are true, His paths are just, and He is able to humble those who walk in arrogance.

verses.text: Belshazzar the king made a great banquet for a thousand of his nobles, and drank wine in the presence of the thousand.
parts: Belshazzar the king made a great banquet for a thousand of his nobles, and drank wine in the presence of the thousand.

verses.text: While he tasted the wine, Belshazzar commanded to bring in the gold and silver vessels which Nebuchadnezzar his father had brought from the temple in Jerusalem, so the king, his nobles, his concubines, and his wives might drink from them.
parts: While he tasted the wine, Belshazzar commanded to bring in the gold and silver vessels which Nebuchadnezzar his father had brought from the temple in Jerusalem, so the king, his nobles, his concubines, and his wives might drink from them.

verses.text: Thus the gold and silver vessels which he had brought from the temple of God in Jerusalem were brought in, and the king, his nobles, his concubines, and his wives drank from them.
parts: Thus the gold and silver vessels which he had brought from the temple of God in Jerusalem were brought in, and the king, his nobles, his concubines, and his wives drank from them.

verses.text: They drank wine and praised the gods made of gold, silver, copper, iron, wood, and stones.
parts: They drank wine and praised the gods made of gold, silver, copper, iron, wood, and stones.

verses.text: In the same hour, the fingers of a man's hand came forth and wrote opposite the lamp on the plaster of the wall in the king's house; and the king saw the knuckles of the hand that wrote.
parts: In the same hour, the fingers of a man's hand came forth and wrote opposite the lamp on the plaster of the wall in the king's house; and the king saw the knuckles of the hand that wrote.

verses.text: Then the appearance of the king changed, and his thoughts troubled him greatly.
parts: Then the appearance of the king changed, and his thoughts troubled him greatly.

verses.text: So the king cried aloud to bring in the magicians, the Chaldeans and the diviners.
parts: So the king cried aloud to bring in the magicians, the Chaldeans and the diviners.

verses.text: Now all the king's wise men entered, but they could not read the writing or make known the interpretation to the king.
parts: Now all the king's wise men entered, but they could not read the writing or make known the interpretation to the king.

verses.text: So Belshazzar the king was greatly troubled, and his appearance changed in him; thus his nobles were very distressed.
parts: So Belshazzar the king was greatly troubled, and his appearance changed in him; thus his nobles were very distressed.

verses.text: Then the queen entered the banquet hall and spoke, saying, “O king, live forever!
parts: Then the queen entered the banquet hall and spoke, saying, “O king, live forever!

verses.text: There is a man in your kingdom in whom is the Spirit of God.
parts: There is a man in your kingdom in whom is the Spirit of God.

verses.text: Inasmuch as an excellent spirit, discernment, understanding, interpreting dreams, revealing things to be grasped, and explaining difficult sayings were found in Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar, now therefore, let him be summoned and he will tell you its interpretation.”
parts: Inasmuch as an excellent spirit, discernment, understanding, interpreting dreams, revealing things to be grasped, and explaining difficult sayings were found in Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar, now therefore, let him be summoned and he will tell you its interpretation.”

verses.text: Then Daniel was led in before the king, and the king said to Daniel, “Are you the Daniel from the children of the captives of Judea, whom my father the king brought here?
parts: Then Daniel was led in before the king, and the king said to Daniel, “Are you the Daniel from the children of the captives of Judea, whom my father the king brought here?

verses.text: I have heard of you, that the Spirit of God is in you, and vigilance, understanding, and an excellent wisdom are found in you.
parts: I have heard of you, that the Spirit of God is in you, and vigilance, understanding, and an excellent wisdom are found in you.

verses.text: Now the wise men, the magicians, the diviners came before me to read this writing and make known its interpretation; but they could not reveal it to me.
parts: Now the wise men, the magicians, the diviners came before me to read this writing and make known its interpretation; but they could not reveal it to me.

verses.text: Then I heard about you, that you are able to interpret matters requiring a judgment.
parts: Then I heard about you, that you are able to interpret matters requiring a judgment.

verses.text: Then Daniel answered and said before the king, “Let your gifts be for yourself, and give the privilege of your house to another.
parts: Then Daniel answered and said before the king, “Let your gifts be for yourself, and give the privilege of your house to another.

verses.text: O king, the Most High God gave Nebuchadnezzar your father a kingdom, majesty, honor, and glory.
parts: O king, the Most High God gave Nebuchadnezzar your father a kingdom, majesty, honor, and glory.

verses.text: So because of the majesty He gave him, all peoples, tribes, and languages trembled and feared before him.
parts: So because of the majesty He gave him, all peoples, tribes, and languages trembled and feared before him.

verses.text: But when his heart was lifted up and his spirit was hardened with arrogance, he was deposed from his kingly throne, and his honor was taken from him.
parts: But when his heart was lifted up and his spirit was hardened with arrogance, he was deposed from his kingly throne, and his honor was taken from him.

verses.text: Then he was driven from men, his heart was made like that of wild animals, and his dwelling was with the wild donkeys.
parts: Then he was driven from men, his heart was made like that of wild animals, and his dwelling was with the wild donkeys.

verses.text: “But you his son, Belshazzar, have not humbled your heart, although you knew all this.
parts: “But you his son, Belshazzar, have not humbled your heart, although you knew all this.

verses.text: Nevertheless you lifted yourself up against the Lord God of heaven and brought the vessels of His house before you.
parts: Nevertheless you lifted yourself up against the Lord God of heaven and brought the vessels of His house before you.

verses.text: “Therefore the finger of the hand was sent by Him, and He ordered this writing.
parts: “Therefore the finger of the hand was sent by Him, and He ordered this writing.

verses.text: So this is the writing He ordered: Mene, Tekel, Upharsin.
parts: So this is the writing He ordered: Mene, Tekel, Upharsin.

verses.text: Now this is the interpretation of each word.
parts: Now this is the interpretation of each word.

verses.text: Tekel: He weighed you on the scales, but you were found lacking.
parts: Tekel: He weighed you on the scales, but you were found lacking.

verses.text: Upharsin: Your kingdom has been divided and given to the Medes and Persians.”
parts: Upharsin: Your kingdom has been divided and given to the Medes and Persians.”

verses.text: Then Belshazzar gave the command, and they clothed Daniel in purple, put a gold chain around his neck, and proclaimed him to be the third ruler in the kingdom.
parts: Then Belshazzar gave the command, and they clothed Daniel in purple, put a gold chain around his neck, and proclaimed him to be the third ruler in the kingdom.

verses.text: That very night Belshazzar, king of the Chaldeans, was put to death.
parts: That very night Belshazzar, king of the Chaldeans, was put to death.

verses.text: Now Darius the Mede received the kingdom.
parts: Now Darius the Mede received the kingdom.

verses.text: It pleased Darius to set one hundred and twenty governors over the kingdom, so they might be throughout his entire kingdom.
parts: It pleased Darius to set one hundred and twenty governors over the kingdom, so they might be throughout his entire kingdom.

verses.text: He also set three administrators above these, one of whom was Daniel, so the governors might give account to them, that the king might not be troubled.
parts: He also set three administrators above these, one of whom was Daniel, so the governors might give account to them, that the king might not be troubled.

verses.text: But Daniel excelled beyond them, because there was an excellent spirit in him, and the king set him over his entire kingdom.
parts: But Daniel excelled beyond them, because there was an excellent spirit in him, and the king set him over his entire kingdom.

verses.text: The administrators and governors sought to find some charge against Daniel, but they could find no charge or wrongdoing or fault against him because he was faithful.
parts: The administrators and governors sought to find some charge against Daniel, but they could find no charge or wrongdoing or fault against him because he was faithful.

verses.text: Then the administrators said, “We will find nothing against Daniel unless we find it in the laws of his God.”
parts: Then the administrators said, “We will find nothing against Daniel unless we find it in the laws of his God.”

verses.text: So the administrators and the governors stood before the king and said to him, “King Darius, live forever!
parts: So the administrators and the governors stood before the king and said to him, “King Darius, live forever!

verses.text: All the commanders, governors, the highest officials, and the regional officers have consulted together to establish a royal statute and a firm decree, that whoever petitions any god or man for thirty days, except from you, O king, shall be cast into the den of lions.
parts: All the commanders, governors, the highest officials, and the regional officers have consulted together to establish a royal statute and a firm decree, that whoever petitions any god or man for thirty days, except from you, O king, shall be cast into the den of lions.

verses.text: Now therefore, O king, establish the decree and exhibit the writing publicly, so the decree of the Medes and Persians cannot be changed.”
parts: Now therefore, O king, establish the decree and exhibit the writing publicly, so the decree of the Medes and Persians cannot be changed.”

verses.text: Then King Darius gave orders to write the decree.
parts: Then King Darius gave orders to write the decree.

verses.text: Now when Daniel learned that the decree was posted, he entered his house, where the windows facing Jerusalem were open to him in the upper rooms, and he knelt down on his knees three times that day and prayed and gave thanks to his God, as he was doing before.
parts: Now when Daniel learned that the decree was posted, he entered his house, where the windows facing Jerusalem were open to him in the upper rooms, and he knelt down on his knees three times that day and prayed and gave thanks to his God, as he was doing before.

verses.text: Then those men watched Daniel closely and found him praying and making supplication before his God.
parts: Then those men watched Daniel closely and found him praying and making supplication before his God.

verses.text: So they approached the king and said, “O king, did you not give orders that any man who petitioned anything from any god or man, except from you, he would be cast into the den of lions?” The king replied, saying, “The word is true, and the decree of the Medes and Persians shall not pass away.”
parts: So they approached the king and said, “O king, did you not give orders that any man who petitioned anything from any god or man, except from you, he would be cast into the den of lions?” The king replied, saying, “The word is true, and the decree of the Medes and Persians shall not pass away.”

verses.text: Then they answered and said before the king, “Daniel, who is from the captives of Judea, does not obey your order concerning the decree you commanded, for he prays and petitions his God three times a day.” Then when the king heard this word, he was very sad in himself, and he struggled hard to deliver Daniel, and did his best to deliver him until evening.
parts: Then they answered and said before the king, “Daniel, who is from the captives of Judea, does not obey your order concerning the decree you commanded, for he prays and petitions his God three times a day.” Then when the king heard this word, he was very sad in himself, and he struggled hard to deliver Daniel, and did his best to deliver him until evening.

verses.text: Then when the king heard this word, he was very sad in himself, and he struggled hard to deliver Daniel, and did his best to deliver him until evening.
parts: Then when the king heard this word, he was very sad in himself, and he struggled hard to deliver Daniel, and did his best to deliver him until evening.

verses.text: Then those men said to the king, “Know, O king, that it is a law of the Medes and Persians that no decree or statute the king establishes can be altered.”
parts: Then those men said to the king, “Know, O king, that it is a law of the Medes and Persians that no decree or statute the king establishes can be altered.”

verses.text: After that, the king gave the command, and they brought Daniel and cast him into the den of lions.
parts: After that, the king gave the command, and they brought Daniel and cast him into the den of lions.

verses.text: Then they brought a stone and placed it over the mouth of the den; and the king sealed it with his ring and with the ring of his nobles, so the matter concerning Daniel might not be changed.
parts: Then they brought a stone and placed it over the mouth of the den; and the king sealed it with his ring and with the ring of his nobles, so the matter concerning Daniel might not be changed.

verses.text: The king then went to his house and spent the night without his evening meal; for they brought no meats to him, and his sleep departed from him.
parts: The king then went to his house and spent the night without his evening meal; for they brought no meats to him, and his sleep departed from him.

verses.text: Then the king arose early in the morning at daybreak and went in haste to the den of lions. As he approached the den, he cried with a loud voice, “Daniel, servant of the living God, has your God, whom you serve continually, been able to deliver you from the mouth of the lions?” Daniel said to the king, “O king, live forever!

parts: Daniel said to the king, “O king, live forever!

parts: My God sent His angel and shut the mouths of the lions so they did not destroy me, because uprightness was found in me before Him, and I did no wrongdoing in His sight.”

verses.text: Then the king rejoiced greatly over him and gave orders to bring Daniel out of the den; and no corruption was found in him, because he believed in his God.
parts: Then the king rejoiced greatly over him and gave orders to bring Daniel out of the den; and no corruption was found in him, because he believed in his God.

verses.text: The king then gave orders, and they brought the men who brought charges against Daniel; and they cast them, their children, and their wives into the den of lions.
parts: The king then gave orders, and they brought the men who brought charges against Daniel; and they cast them, their children, and their wives into the den of lions.

verses.text: Now Darius the king wrote to all peoples, tribes, and languages who dwell in all the earth:
parts: Now Darius the king wrote to all peoples, tribes, and languages who dwell in all the earth:

verses.text: “A decree was made in my presence, that in every dominion of my kingdom, men must tremble and fear before the God of Daniel, because He is the living God; He endures unto the ages.
parts: “A decree was made in my presence, that in every dominion of my kingdom, men must tremble and fear before the God of Daniel, because He is the living God; He endures unto the ages.

verses.text: He helps and rescues, and works signs and wonders in heaven and on earth; for He delivered Daniel from the power of the lions.”
parts: He helps and rescues, and works signs and wonders in heaven and on earth; for He delivered Daniel from the power of the lions.”

verses.text: So Daniel prospered in the kingdom of Darius and in the kingdom of Cyrus the Persian.
parts: So Daniel prospered in the kingdom of Darius and in the kingdom of Cyrus the Persian.

verses.text: In the first year of Belshazzar, king of the Chaldeans, Daniel saw a dream and visions in his head upon his bed.
parts: In the first year of Belshazzar, king of the Chaldeans, Daniel saw a dream and visions in his head upon his bed.

verses.text: I, Daniel, looked on in my vision in the night, and behold, the four winds of heaven blew violently upon the great sea.
parts: I, Daniel, looked on in my vision in the night, and behold, the four winds of heaven blew violently upon the great sea.

verses.text: Then four large beasts came up from the sea, each different from the other.
parts: Then four large beasts came up from the sea, each different from the other.

verses.text: The first was like a lioness, and it had wings like an eagle.
parts: The first was like a lioness, and it had wings like an eagle.

verses.text: After this, behold, there was a second beast like a bear.
parts: After this, behold, there was a second beast like a bear.

verses.text: After this, I kept looking and behold, there was another beast like a leopard, and it had the four wings of a bird on its back.
parts: After this, I kept looking and behold, there was another beast like a leopard, and it had the four wings of a bird on its back.

verses.text: After this, I looked and behold, a fourth beast, fearful, terrifying, and exceedingly strong.
parts: After this, I looked and behold, a fourth beast, fearful, terrifying, and exceedingly strong.

verses.text: I was especially noticing its horns, and behold, there was another horn, a little one.
parts: I was especially noticing its horns, and behold, there was another horn, a little one.

verses.text: I continued to watch until thrones were put in place, and the Ancient of Days enthroned Himself.
parts: I continued to watch until thrones were put in place, and the Ancient of Days enthroned Himself.

parts: Then I kept watching because of the sound of the arrogant words the horn was speaking.

parts: After this, the saints of the Most High shall receive the kingdom and possess it unto ages of ages.”

parts: Then I sought the precise meaning of the fourth beast, for it was different from all the others.

parts: The ten horns on its head and the other horn, which had eyes and a mouth that spoke arrogant things, and the vision of which I noticed more than the rest, came up and knocked down the three horns before it.

parts: Its ten horns are ten kings.

parts: Then I lifted up my eyes and looked, and behold, one ram stood before the Ulai, and it had horns.

parts: I heard the voice of this man in the midst of the Ulai, and he called and said, “Gabriel, cause that man to understand the vision.”

parts: Thus he came and stood near where I was standing; and when he came, I was astonished and fell on my face.

parts: The male goat is the king of the Greeks, and the great horn between its eyes is the first king.

parts: Yes, all Israel transgressed Your law and turned aside, so as not to obey Your voice.

verses.text: So He confirmed His words which He spoke against us and against our judges who judged us, by bringing upon us great calamities; for under the whole heaven such has not taken place, as the things that happened in Jerusalem.

verses.text: As it is written in the Law of Moses, all these calamities came upon us, yet we have not entreated the Lord our God so as to turn from our wrongdoings, and to gain insight into all Your truth.

parts: Therefore the Lord watched and brought all these things upon us, for the Lord our God is righteous in every work He does, though we have not obeyed His voice.

verses.text: So now, O Lord our God, who brought Your people from the land of Egypt with a strong hand, and who made Yourself a name as it is this day, we have sinned and acted lawlessly.

verses.text: “O Lord, in all Your mercy, let Your anger and Your wrath be turned away from Your city of Jerusalem, Your holy mountain, though we have sinned; for in our wrongdoings and those of our fathers, Jerusalem and Your people have become a disgrace among all those around us.
parts: “O Lord, in all Your mercy, let Your anger and Your wrath be turned away from Your city of Jerusalem, Your holy mountain, though we have sinned; for in our wrongdoings and those of our fathers, Jerusalem and Your people have become a disgrace among all those around us.

verses.text: So now, O Lord our God, listen to the prayers of Your servant and his supplications, and cause Your face to shine on Your sanctuary, which is deserted because of You, O Lord.
parts: So now, O Lord our God, listen to the prayers of Your servant and his supplications, and cause Your face to shine on Your sanctuary, which is deserted because of You, O Lord.

verses.text: O my God, incline Your ear and hear; open Your eyes and see our destruction and that of Your city, in which Your name is called upon; for not on the basis of our righteous deeds do we bring our prayer for mercy before You, but on the basis of Your abundant mercy.

parts: O Lord, hear!

You shall know therefore and understand that from the going forth of the word to be answered and to build Jerusalem, until Christ the Prince, there shall be seven weeks and sixty-two weeks.

parts: In the third year of Cyrus king of the Persians, a word was revealed to Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar.

verses.text: In those days, I, Daniel, was mourning three full weeks.
parts: In those days, I, Daniel, was mourning three full weeks.

parts: I ate no desirable food, and no meat or wine entered my mouth, nor did I anoint myself, until three whole weeks were fulfilled.

parts: Then on the twenty-fourth day of the first month, I was beside the great river, that is, the Tigris.

parts: I lifted my eyes and looked, and behold, there was a man clothed in fine linen; and his waist was girded with gold of Uphaz.

parts: His body was like beryl, and his face like the appearance of lightning.

parts: I, Daniel, alone saw the vision, for the men with me did not see the vision; but a great astonishment fell upon them, and they fled in fear.

parts: So I was left alone and saw this great vision, but no strength remained in me; for my splendor was turned into corruption, and I retained no strength.

parts: When he had spoken these words to me, I turned my face toward the ground and was deeply troubled.

parts: Then again, the one like the appearance of a man touched me and strengthened me.

parts: Then he said, “Do you know why I have come to you?

author: Daniel, whose name means, “God is my Judge” or “God is judging,” wrote the book that carries his name.
date: Traditionally thought to have been written during the Babylonian captivity (605–530 BC).
theme: The sovereignty of God over all nations is set forth and illustrated by the truth that God directs history for the fulfillment of His purposes and plans. The blessings of God are granted to those who refrain from idol worship and turn to Him. Finally, throughout the book, we see the vanity of idol worship shown by its effect on the lives of those who pursue it.

While types of Christ in the Old Testament prefigure His coming in the flesh, theopha-nies are recognized by the Church as being actual appearances of the pre-incarnate Son and Word of God. How this happens remains a mystery. But because the Son of God took on human nature in the fullness of time, each theophany directly prefigures Christ’s Incarnation. St. John of Damascus wrote, “No one saw the divine nature, but rather the image and figure of what was yet to come. For the invisible Son and Word of God was to become truly Man.”
